Title: A Tale of Two Detectives Ep.4
SubTitle: No Translation

Text: Her heart beats faster and faster.

(Wh-Where is he taking me? Is he going to keep
holding my hand the whole time...? Oh no!!!)
C-Cid!
Shush. Let's hide.
O-Okay...
They hide in the shadow of a hedge.

(C-Cid is so close to me...! I can hear him
breathing... Wait, does that mean he can
hear me breathing, too?!)

(Oh...wh-wh-what should I do... My heart is pounding
so hard...that my brain won't work!)

(But I need to calm myself down as best I can! Okay,
first, let's figure out what we're doing here.)
Um, C-Cid? Why are we hiding?
There are many reasons.
Like what?
I've felt a pair of eyes on us for a while.
What?!
Shush!
S-Sorry...

But...were we really being watched? Who would
do such a thing?
I think we'll find out soon enough.
Where did they go?!

I think they went this way...but I don't see anyone
here.
Oh!

Cid is right...voices are getting closer. She clamps
a hand over her mouth.
I knew they'd come.
(If I remember correctly, this duo is...)
I'll be right back.
Huh? Cid? P-Please, wait for me!

She frantically chases after Cid as he takes off
running.
What're you doing?
Ack!
Oh. Hi, Cid...
Who are these people...

Yeahhh, well, these are my frieN-PCs...er, I mean, my
friends. Skel and Po.

The friends that Cid introduces to her... Sherry
remembers seeing them with Cid many times
before.
H-Hello, Miss Sherry Barnett...
Hello. Um, so you're Skel...and Po?
Yes, I'm Po! Just call me Po!

Who cares what people call you? Anyway,
why were you tailing us?

Um, rude much? We weren't tailing you. We were just
checking up on you a teeny bit. R-Right?

Yes, of course. We definitely weren't doing anything
shady...
Funny. Then why're your eyes so shifty?
Our eyes ain't shifty!
Um, excuse me!
Why were you checking up on us a "teeny bit"?
W-Well, because...

Looks like the jig is up... I'll confess. We were
tailing you both...

To prevent your relationship from going to the next
level!
Um...what?

Hey, we know you guys've been hanging out one-on-one
and eating homemade cookies!

Why, only today, you two not only shared a lunch, but
you saw each other after school, too, correct?

With you meeting so often...and being so friendly...
d-don't tell me, are you two...already...?!
What?!

Po's words make her gasp out loud. Immediately after,
she feels her face burning.
Nothing's going on between us.
Urk...
(You didn't have to deny it so bluntly...)

So that's why you were tailing us...to sniff out our
relationship.
Yeah...
Is that all you were doing?
W-Well, we...
Did you...send someone a threatening letter?
A th-threatening letter?!
All we sent was a normal letter, man!
Huh...?

But your intentions were unclear, and there wasn't a
return address. Wouldn't you be scared if you got a
letter like that?

But we used a very elegant envelope and stationery,
and we wrote the body of the letter as politely as
possible...
And yet...we still scared her. I am so sorry.

I'm sorry, too... When we saw our friend get closer
to a girl, we just couldn't sit still!
Why is it always Cid!
We're sons of barons too, ya know!

What do you wanna do? You could forgive them, or turn
them over to the assistant principal.
The assistant principal?! Pl-Please let this slide!
We were wrong! We're sorry! We'll never do it again!

Sherry can't help but giggle seeing the desperate
duo beg for her forgiveness.
Understood. Apology accepted.
Really?!
Thank you so much! We'll never do it again!
And with that, Skel Etal and Po Tato scurry away.
Are you sure it was okay to forgive them so easily?

Heehee, yes. It was a relief to see that
they really did mean no harm.

Well, as long as you're cool with it, that's all that
matters. I need to apologize, too.
Huh? But why would you need to apologize, Cid?

Because my friends were the culprits and I was part
of their motive.
They didn't want me to become a normie.
Nor-mee?

Oh, never mind. Anyway, I'm really sorry things got
kinda crazy there.
But you don't need to apologize, Cid!

You solved the case for me, and you were there for me
when I was feeling anxious.

If the one who saved me apologizes, that only makes
me feel guilty.
Is that how it works?
Yes, it is. Besides...

(I suppose this means Cid and I look so close that
his friends had a misunderstanding...)
Besides? What?

N-Nothing! Anyway, I'm going to go tell Alexia that
the case has been solved.

When I told her about the threatening letter, she was
very sympathetic... Oh! I won't give her the names of
your friends, of course.

Yeah...if the princess finds out they threatened her
senior, there'll be hell to pay...
Yes, indeed. That's why I won't tell her.

Thanks. I'll make those guys make it up to you soon.
With a gift.

Heehee, oh, you don't need to do that. I know they've
learned their lesson.

But if you're really that concerned about it, then...
would you go out with me sometime?
What're you talking about?
To the school cafe... I want to eat cake with you.
Sure. But why cake?

It's a trope in the girl-detective series. After
solving a case, Girllock Holmes and her partner
always go out for tea and sweets afterwards.
Oh, she has a partner?
Wait, didn't I mention it?
Not until now.

This wasn't revealed until the most recent volume,
but her partner actually operates in the shadows
with a⁠—whoa, I don't want to spoil it for you, so I'll
stop there.
So...will you go out with me?
For cake? Sure. I'd love to.
(Hooray! Broadly interpreted...this is a date!)

A big smile fills her face at Cid's answer. At any
rate, the Case of the Threatening Letter was solved.
Ohhh! I forgot something really important!

What is it? Did you change your mind and decide to
punish those guys after all?

N-No, it's not that! Arrrgh! I had it all ready and
everything, and I forgot to use my detective's pipe...

And I couldn't elegantly say the catchphrase when we
caught the culprits either... O-Oh... Hey! Could you
please...um...ask your friends to confess again?
